decided on heading up to her room.

Normally when starting a new job, it would be professional to meet your boss first. Maybe toss around some smal ltalk with one's fellow teachers, get to know your surroundings, and then find your room. But honestly, Liz had experienced a very long, very dull plane ride and taken two buses just to arrive on time today. If anyone deserved to put her heavy luggage down, it was her! Besides, it wasn't like the teachers were going anywhere! She'd have plenty of time to meet the women that made this place turn after she found her dorm. Of course, in order to find her dorm, she had to actually walk into the school first...

Realizing that she was getting just a little bit ahead of herself, Liz inhaled a calming dose of the chilled air and let out a satisfied sigh, taking a moment to get a good look at the academy. Gorgeous, just as the brochures promised. It looked very much like a church, one of the many cathedrals scattered about Canada's luscious expanse no doubt having been converted into a school. From the worn stony outside and it's spacious courtyards where many a student (actually... those girls were pretty chunky!) engaged in many an activity, Liz had to crane her neck upwards to get a full view of F.A.T.'s uppermost levels. It had turrets, as many churches do, that pierced the cloudy skies and cast a horned, intimidating shadow. Stained glass windows decorated the front, two on each symmetrical level of the turrets starting at the slant of the cathedral's roof, where one giant one adorned the middle body, and ending after two levels to make way for the spires. From the frontmost gates, Liz could faintly make out some gargoyles on the school, mostly surrounding the points. And, of course, it was intimidating to be standing in front of such a presitgious school in a country she knew nothing about. The air about this place seemed to delicately whisper "I am so much better than you..." It scared her and yet she was not afraid...

"Ahem." a gentle learing of a strange throat startled her, breaking her awed state suddenly and whipping her head to the left, where said cough came from. Off to the left of the academy, directly in front of the gate where she had been standing and somewhat ot of place, was a small eloquent hut. It seemed like an addition to, rather than a part of, the cathedral that had become F.A.T. and looked almost brand new. In leiu of a front door, which would complete the illusion of a living quarters, there was a broad, intimidatingly wide woman with black hair, peircing eyes, and a rather prominant stomach that jut out along with her soft features. She was the one who had coughed. "If you're going to come in, you should just come in already." she said brashly, putting her chubby hands underneath her muffin top, "Don't just stand there like a lump."

Caught off guard, Liz could only stutter and stammer as she was confronted by this intimidatingly large woman. "Oh, I uh, I..." she tripped over her tongue, unable to form a coherent alaby as to why she was darkening the doorway of this magnificent school. Finally, her struggling mouth managed to say, "I'm the new teacher here, Liz Onnia!" in a rather loud and excited tone. Instantly, the beefy woman let out a hearty laugh and her expression softened up quite a bit, "Well why didn't you say so?" she said cheerfully, "It's my fault, I really should have recognized that familiar "deer caught in the headlights look"!" She took the single step to the ground (huh, so there was a door there...) which caused her enormity to wobble about in her blue guard uniform and the black bun of hair resting on her neck to bounce with her cheeks. She wobbled up awkwardly to Liz and gave her a friendly pat on the shoulder, "Well come to the F.A.T. life, Onnia!" she said in a very friendly manner, "Name's Sharon, I work security down here."

Liz smiled at her, welcoming the friendly demeanor much more openheartedly than her tough act, "Security, is there really much of a problem with stuff like that around here?" Liz questioned, hoping to not seem too rude, "I mean, with crime and stuff." Sharon rolled her eyes and let out a little chuckle, "Yeah, not much goes on in my department hun, just sitting around all day getting fat." she smacked her heavy stomach to emphasize her heavy point, "But the perks are nice; health, dental, a 401k, even free donuts." Liz creased her bottom lip and flexed her eyebrows, nodding in approval. "Sounds nice, Sharon." she said, trying not to look at her coworker's still-wobbling midsection. "Yup, those donuts are pretty great." Sharon joked, "So, enough about that, you've got class in about an hour, do you know where you're going?"

Liz searched her purse for the acceptance envelope; the one that contained her room number, temporary teacher pass, and schedule, only to no avail. She must have left it somewhere in that wreck of a suitcase she had been wheeling around for the two-day duration of her trip. "Oh, it's probably in my luggage..." she said solemnly, dreading having to dig out one slip of paper from that ginormous thing. If she did that, there was no way that she would have time to check out her new room. 'Kinda disappointing' was the only thought that crept into her head as Liz slowly bent over and unzipped the front most pocket of her carry-on...

"Oh, what's this?" Sharon said, wobbling over behind the dreaded luggage carrier, "Y'think this is it?" she asked, huffing and puffing in preperation for the horrible task of reaching past her billowing belly. She grunted and wheezed, leaning over her doughy middle and splitting quite a few seams as she pawed at the folded slip. Finally, the massive guard's chubby fingers caught grasp of it and she began her trek upwards; returning more redfaced and flushed than she was before. "Now then." she began, taking hugely deep gasps of air as she unfolded the paper, "You'll be staying...

Nothing was worse than making a first impression on your first day; especially when you already hadn't met your boss or any of your fellow teachers. But to be late to class, leaving a bunch of girls in the classroom together alone and unsupervised, was practically suicide for her teaching career. And this opinion showed in her mad rush down the spiral staircase, flying down much quicker without having to lug her ponderous suitcase around. She nearly tripped and killed herself a blue million times, something that she couldn't bother herself with at the moment. She was going to be late!

Liz's stampede brought her all the way down to the end of the history wing just as the bell rang. The Female Academy of Toronto had a very expansive, well, expanse about it. For as big as it was outside, inside somehow seemed even larger. Just limiting our vision to the History Wing, one could see that it was obviously very old, yet odified maybe about ten years ago. Bulletin boards were placed between doors where enough space was provided, littered with class projects and due dates and the like, but it was severely lacking in decoration. The only thing, at the end of the hall, was one of the large windows to the side that Liz had failed to notice earlier. It was a gigantic fixture, one that gave her a clear view of an entire courtyard and the bordering forest areas. "Room 404, room 405, room 407..." she said aloud, rushing past the impressive wing and it's quiet elegance hoping to catch her room number, "Room 408... room 410; that's it!!" she squealed, lunging across the hallway at the long-lost door as if it were going somewhere. Her slender hands pulled down on the door handle, only for her to stop and take a second to primp. After fixing a few tray hairs and making sure her makeup was subtle though still applied, Liz professionally and quietly opened the door. "Hello girls, sorry for the wait but I-

And that's when she stopped, having noticed something very odd about a good majority of her class. They were all fat. Not some, not a few, but most of her girls were fat. Big. Huge. Butterballs. FAT. Just about every last one of them! Black, White, Asian, Hispanic, all big and blubbery! There were maybe four- no, three girls (after counting off one in the back who just had a disproportionate lower half) who weren't obese. They were all laughing, talking and doing things that typical teenage girls would do... except they did it while being FAT!! Liz's jaw actually dropped, something that was pretty rude all things considering. But she couldn't help it! From the front row to the back, these girls were squeezed into their uniforms (some even squeezed into their desks)! Suddenly, they all seemed to notice her at once. A majority of them quieted down at her attention though a few carried on. They all awaited her to say something, giving Ms. Onnia her cue:

"I-I got lost, sorry for the wait..." she finally managed, hand falling limply at her side as it fell from the door handle. She slowly walked up to the front of the room, feeling the shock of her "class size" finally start to wear off. "Good morning girls, I'm ,uh, Ms. Onnia and I'll be your history teacher until your second semester." she said, pausing to catch her second wind. After all that running, she was kinda tired. Much less after seeing how chubby her girls were, Liz's heart was a little over worked today. "We've got a lot to do this year and I think it would be appropriate to start off with the Columbian Exchange, so if... do you all have your books?" she stopped, realizing that once again, she had gotten ahead of herself.

At once, all the chubsters in the classroom looked underneath their desk; bending in ways that fat girls weren't meant to bend. The sounds of heavy grunts and labored breaths blended with popping stitches and fabric ripping, even a few wrappers being unwrapped as this simple task labored her lardy lasses. "Woah, woah woah!" she stopped them all with one utterance, "It's fine, here they are!" she said, noticing the stack of books placed beside her desk, "There sure are a lot of you, uh, I mean there sure are a lot of students here, I think I need a volunteer to help me out." she said, gesturing to the classroom.

One girl, so big it looked like she was going to pop right out of her blouse, raised a chubby arm to assist. "I'll pass them out!" she said eagerly, heaving and ho'ing from her seat. She teetered and tottered before Liz finally had to stop her, "No no, it's fine I got it." she said, struggling to keep the big brunette girl in her seat- almost sorry to have made her struggle so hard just to move- before walking over to the big pile of books. She soon found that a summer's worth of laziness and sitting down had left her a little weaker than she remembered, so she was limited to carrying three or four of those heavy history books at a time, leading to a long line of about ten trips back.

By the time she was through, she was out of breath again!

"O-Okay, so... so turn your books to page... to page one-ten... and read to yourselves quietly." she said with labored breath, unable to muster up the wind in her belly to make a long lecture.

Slowly, she trod back to her desk and sat down in her big comfy chair- unwilling to move from this very spot. In fact, why didn't she just teach from her from now on? Her college professor did! (of course, he was kinda big, so she couldn't blame him) But in all seriousness- this chair was really effing comfy. She might actually consider teaching from her desk like a professional.

Quietly, she leaned back and took a deep breath: not even an hour into her teaching career and Liz Onnia was already feeling like a real educator!
